org.apache.mesos.offer

Class MesosResourcePool

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.mesos.offer.MesosResourcePool

  • public class MesosResourcePool
extends java.lang.Object
    A representation of the pool of resources available in a single Offer. Tracks the consumption of the Offer's resources, as they are matched with ResourceRequirements.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MesosResourcePool(Offer offer)
      Creates a new pool of resources based on what's available in the provided Offer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Optional<MesosResource> consume(DynamicPortRequirement dynamicPortRequirement)
      Consumes and returns a MesosResource which meets the provided DynamicPortRequirement, or does nothing and returns an empty Optional if no available resources meet the requirement.
      java.util.Optional<MesosResource> consume(ResourceRequirement resourceRequirement)
      Consumes and returns a MesosResource which meets the provided ResourceRequirement, or does nothing and returns an empty Optional if no available resources meet the requirement.
      Offer getOffer()
      Returns the underlying offer which this resource pool represents.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MesosResource> getReservedPool()
      Returns the resources which are reserved.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<MesosResource>> getUnreservedAtomicPool()
      Returns the unreserved resources which cannot be partially consumed from an Offer.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Value> getUnreservedMergedPool()
      Returns the unreserved resources of which a subset can be consumed from an Offer.
      void release(MesosResource mesosResource)
      Marks the provided resource as available for consumption.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MesosResourcePool

        public MesosResourcePool(Offer offer)
        Creates a new pool of resources based on what's available in the provided Offer.

    • Method Detail

      • getOffer

        public Offer getOffer()
        Returns the underlying offer which this resource pool represents.

      • getUnreservedAtomicPool

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<MesosResource>> getUnreservedAtomicPool()
        Returns the unreserved resources which cannot be partially consumed from an Offer. For example, a MOUNT volume cannot be partially consumed, it's all-or-nothing.

      • getUnreservedMergedPool

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Value> getUnreservedMergedPool()
        Returns the unreserved resources of which a subset can be consumed from an Offer. For example, an offer may contain 4.0 CPUs and 2.4 of those CPUs can be reserved.

      • getReservedPool

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,MesosResource> getReservedPool()
        Returns the resources which are reserved.

      • consume

        public java.util.Optional<MesosResource> consume(ResourceRequirement resourceRequirement)
        Consumes and returns a MesosResource which meets the provided ResourceRequirement, or does nothing and returns an empty Optional if no available resources meet the requirement.

      • consume

        public java.util.Optional<MesosResource> consume(DynamicPortRequirement dynamicPortRequirement)
        Consumes and returns a MesosResource which meets the provided DynamicPortRequirement, or does nothing and returns an empty Optional if no available resources meet the requirement.

      • release

        public void release(MesosResource mesosResource)
        Marks the provided resource as available for consumption.
